DataElement.preferredName: Patient Missed Dose Physician Nurse Instruction Not To Take Reason Data Unknown Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A single character text field to indicate if the patient missed doses for the reason of the physician/nurse instructed not to take.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Missed Dose Physician Nurse Instruction Not To Take Reason
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A dose of medicine that was not taken at the prescribed dosing interval._A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A doctor; a person who has been educated, trained, and licensed to practice the art and science of medicine; a practitioner of medicine, as contrasted with a surgeon._A professional healthcare provider who has graduated from an accredited nursing program, has passed the state exam for licensure, and been registered or licensed to practice by a state authority.  Nurses are educationally prepared as functional (LPN/LVN) or professional (RN)._A message describing how something is to be done._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._As pertains to a medication: ingest, inhale, instill, or inject._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A dose of medicine that was not taken at the prescribed dosing interval.:A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Concepts.definition: A dose of medicine that was not taken at the prescribed dosing interval.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Physician Nurse Instruction Negation To Take Reason
Property.preferredDefinition: A doctor; a person who has been educated, trained, and licensed to practice the art and science of medicine; a practitioner of medicine, as contrasted with a surgeon.:A professional healthcare provider who has graduated from an accredited nursing program, has passed the state exam for licensure, and been registered or licensed to practice by a state authority.  Nurses are educationally prepared as functional (LPN/LVN) or professional (RN).:A message describing how something is to be done.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:As pertains to a medication: ingest, inhale, instill, or inject.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: A doctor; a person who has been educated, trained, and licensed to practice the art and science of medicine; a practitioner of medicine, as contrasted with a surgeon.

A professional healthcare provider who has graduated from an accredited nursing program, has passed the state exam for licensure, and been registered or licensed to practice by a state authority.  Nurses are educationally prepared as functional (LPN/LVN) or professional (RN).
A message describing how something is to be done.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
As pertains to a medication: ingest, inhale, instill, or inject.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a single character text field to record data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
